section.name: SampleStars
section.p: When you install a skycatserver webapp, it comes ready-configured with its own built in sample database for testing purposes. This database is small and so takes up very little room on the disk, and is very useful for checking that your initial installation has worked alright before you start connecting the webapp to your real dataset

The SampleStars database consists of three tables: SampleStars, SampleGalaxies and Plates. You can see the metadoc for these tables by clicking on the 'metadata' link on the installed webapps index page.

The SampleStars table contains a objects described by ID, RA, DEC and MAGnitude. There is an even spread of low brightness 'background' stars in coordinate space at every half degree; which means that this artificial sky is a lot more crowded at the poles than at the equator (as half a degree is a much smaller distance there). There is a little smiley face of brighter stars around where the pleidies are on the real sky (ie around ra 57, dec 24 degrees) and a line of 20 bright stars from (30,30) to (70,10)
The SampleGalaxies table consists of objects described by ID, RA, DEC and SHAPE.

The Plates table consists of objects described by ID, RA, DEC. It provides a way of testing and describing the difference between Object RA/DEC positions that should appear in a cone search, and those that shouldn't.
